Readings.Title:
Weiser, The Computer for the 21st Century: 
 Weiser, M. (1991, September).The Computer for the 21st Century. Scientific American, 265(3), 94–100.

The Coming Age of Calm Technology: 
 Weiser, M., & Brown, J. S. (1997). The Coming Age of Calm Technology. In P. J. Denning & R. M. Metcalfe, Beyond Calculation (pp. 75–85).

Yvonne Rogers commentary on Calm Technology, ten years later 
 Rogers, Y. (2006). Moving on from Weiser’s Vision of Calm Computing: Engaging UbiComp Experiences. In P. Dourish & A. Friday (Eds.), UbiComp 2006: Ubiquitous Computing (Vol. 4206, pp. 404–421).

A brief introduction to research design and validity: Experimental Research by Paul C. Price, Rajiv Jhangiani, I-Chant A. Chiang, Dana C. Leighton, & Carrie Cuttler, chapter 5.  Please read the whole chapter, it’s not very long.

Optional reading: Shadish, Cook, and Campbell’s  
 Shadish, W. R., Cook, T. D., & Campbell, D. T. (2002). Experimental and quasi-experimental designs for generalized causal inference. Boston, MA, US: Houghton, Mifflin and Company.
[♦Optional] Reichardt, C. S. (2011). Criticisms of and an alternative to the Shadish, Cook, and Campbell validity typology. New Directions for Evaluation, 2011(130), 43–53.

Yeykelis, L., Cummings, J. J., & Reeves, B. (2014). Multitasking on a Single Device: Arousal and the Frequency, Anticipation, and Prediction of Switching Between Media Content on a Computer: Multitasking and Arousal. Journal of Communication, 64(1), 167–192.

Lab.Title: Student life project relevance and assignment

Readings.Title: Fogg, B. (2009). A behavior model for persuasive design. Proceedings of the 4th International Conference on Persuasive Technology, 40:1–40:7.

Rabbi, M., Aung, M. H., Zhang, M., & Choudhury, T. (2015). MyBehavior: Automatic personalized health feedback from user behaviors and preferences using smartphones. Proceedings of the 2015 ACM International Joint Conference on Pervasive and Ubiquitous Computing - UbiComp’15, 707–718.

[♦Optional] Adams, A. T., Costa, J., Jung, M. F., & Choudhury, T. (2015). Mindless computing: Designing technologies to subtly influence behavior. Proceedings of the 2015 ACM International Joint Conference on Pervasive and Ubiquitous Computing - UbiComp ’15, 719–730.
Karen’s paper on exposing images from nursing home – privacy value vs data value

Lab.Title: Run privacy checkup for google and phone

Readings.Title: Russell, J. A. (1980). A circumplex model of affect. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 39(6), 1161–1178.
Ekman, P. (1993). Facial expression and emotion. American Psychologist, 48(4), 384–392.

McDuff, D., el Kaliouby, R., Senechal, T., Amr, M., Cohn, J. F., & Picard, R. (2013). Affectiva-MIT Facial Expression Dataset (AM-FED): Naturalistic and Spontaneous Facial Expressions Collected In-the-Wild. 2013 IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Workshops, 881–888.

[♦ Optional]Emotion and psychophysiology 
 Bradley, M. M., & Lang, P. J. (2007). Emotion and motivation. In J. T. Cacioppo, L. G. Tassinary, & G. G. Berntson (Eds.), Handbook of psychophysiology (3rd ed.) (pp. 581–607). New York, NY, US: Cambridge University Press.

Lab.Title: Use affectiva SDK or other face-coding engine to see what happens with posed vs. evoked faces
